title: Mini Google Search Engine
description: Built a full-stack mini search engine in C/C++ from scratch that indexes files, stores data on disk, and serves ranked search results via a multithreaded HTTP server with browser support. The project includes a web crawler, indexer, and query processor, implementing data structures like hash tables, linked lists, and heaps to optimize search performance.

title: SimpleDB
description: SimpleDB is a fully functional, educational relational database system built from scratch in Java, designed to simulate the core components of modern RDBMS systems. This project showcases a complete backend architecture including query processing, memory management, concurrency control, transaction logging, and more.

title: Paxos Made Simple
description: Built a fully functional implementation of the Paxos consensus protocol from scratch in Java. Demonstrates a real-world fault-tolerant architecture for achieving consensus across unreliable and asynchronous nodes. Includes key distributed systems concepts such as leader election, proposal and acceptor roles, log replication, message retransmission, and crash recovery. Emphasizes robustness in the face of network partitions and node failures, laying the foundation for replicated state machines and consistent system behavior.

title: Grocery Store Business ML Model and Basket Analysis
description: Created a machine learning linear regression model that uses data from an Australian grocery store to train the model to predict the total sales, total cost, and quantity of items sold for the store as a whole. Model could be used to also make same predictions for each category and subcategory of items sold.

title: Towers of Hanoi AI Solver
description: The project explores reinforcement learning techniques, specifically Value Iteration and Q-Learning, applied to a Markov Decision Process (MDP) in the context of solving the Towers of Hanoi (TOH) puzzle. It demonstrates how an agent can learn optimal policies through both model-based planning (Value Iteration) and model-free learning (Q-Learning) in a simulated environment.

title: AI Pacman
description: The project explores adversarial search techniques, specifically Minimax, Alpha-Beta Pruning, and Expectimax, applied to a multi-agent environment in the context of the classic Pacman game. It demonstrates how agents can navigate competitive and uncertain environments by employing strategic decision-making techniques, from deterministic adversarial play (Minimax) to probabilistic modeling (Expectimax), showcasing how each approach impacts performance in complex game scenarios.

title: UW Calendar Exporter
description: 80+ Users. Streamlining class scheduling for University of Washington students with automated calendar integration. This project enables direct export of course details from the UW registration page to Google or Apple Calendar, automatically populating essential information like course names, locations, and times. By eliminating manual entry, it simplifies schedule management and enhances the registration experience, providing a seamless, user-centered solution for efficient academic planning.

title: RateMyProf Assistant for UW MyPlan Chrome Extension
description: 100+ Users. Empowering students with informed course selection through integrated professor ratings. This project brings real-time data from RateMyProfessors into the University of Washington’s MyPlan platform, displaying key metrics like professor ratings, difficulty levels, and 'Would Take Again' percentages. By offering these insights within the course planning tool, it enables students to make data-driven choices and streamlines the registration process, adding valuable context to their academic planning.

title: UW CourseKeeper Chrome Extension
description: 60+ Users. Simplifying UW course registration with one-click SLN access. Inspired by my own challenges with finding and entering SLN codes quickly before classes filled up, this tool synchronizes notifications from MyPlan and Notify.UW, providing direct dropdown access to SLN codes on the registration page. By reducing errors and speeding up input, it offers students a seamless, efficient registration experience that eliminates the rush and stress of last-minute code searches.

title: Beacon: Disaster Response App Prototype
description: 1st place Hackathon winner! Beacon is a disaster response app designed to keep communities safe by addressing critical gaps in communication during emergencies. It delivers real-time, hyper-localized updates, offline access to shelters and first aid resources, and Bluetooth communication for when networks fail. With AI-powered assistance and a focus on accessibility, Beacon ensures individuals are informed, prepared, and connected when it matters most.

title: ChronoVRse: Time Travel VR App Prototype
description: This app leverages virtual reality to enable users to explore historical events and future scenarios in an immersive, educational environment. It allows users to navigate through time with a simple interface, experiencing the richness of history and the possibilities of the future firsthand.

title: Headsora: AI Mental Health App Prototype
description: AI-powered virtual therapist assistant created for mental health therapy. Using cutting-edge machine learning and natural language processing methods, Headsora provides an easy way for people to communicate with a virtual counselor, boosting emotional well-being and encouraging self-improvement. Goal is to remove obstacles like cost, stigma, and location that prevent people from getting assistance.

title: PocketMarket: Online Farmer's Market App Prototype
description: Pocket Market is a virtual street-market experience designed to bring the charm, spontaneity, and human connection of local markets to the digital world. Inspired by the vibrant atmosphere of farmers’ and flea markets, it blends playful UI with practical features like swipeable browsing, vendor storytelling, and live chat. Pocket Market empowers small businesses by removing physical barriers and setup costs, while allowing shoppers to explore, connect, and buy from real people in their local communities. The goal is to make shopping local feel just as fun, personal, and serendipitous online as it is in person.

title: College Football Predictive Analysis
description: Data-Driven Analysis of NCAA Division 1 Football Metrics for Performance Insights. Using advanced data analysis techniques, this project merges multiple datasets to explore key performance indicators in college football. By examining offensive and defensive rankings, rushing and passing metrics, and special teams efficiency, the project aims to identify trends and factors that contribute to winning games. The goal is to provide actionable insights that challenge conventional wisdom, emphasizing the significance of offense and punt return efficiency over traditional defensive metrics.

title: Money Manager Web App
technologies: Python, SQL, Flask, Jinja, HTML, CSS, and Javascript
description: Money managing web application used for tracking expenses and budgets. Number of functionalities such as budgeting goals, expense listing, income tracking, currency conversion, and much more.

title: eCommerce Auction Web App
technologies: Python, SQL, Django, Jinja, HTML, and CSS
description: ECommerce auction web application similar to eBay used for selling and buying goods. Number of functionalities such as user registration/authentication, creating listings for items, bidding/auction system, and much more.

title: Stock Trading Simulation
technologies: Python, SQL, Flask, Jinja, APIs, HTML, and CSS
description: Stock trading simulation web application used to simulate buying/selling of stocks and shares using real-time API market data. Number of functionalities such as user registration/authentication, buying/selling shares, trend data, and much more.

title: Allergen Detection Scanner Web App
technologies: Python, Flask, JavaScript, Jinja, OpenCV, PyTesseract, NLTK, HTML, and CSS
description: Allergy detection web application similar to a label scanner used for detecting allergens in food products. Number of functionalities such as image upload/capture, allergen detection, managing allergen lists, and much more.

title: Wiki Online Encyclopedia
technologies: Python, SQL, Django, Jinja, Markdown, HTML, and CSS
description: Wiki encyclopedia web app similar to Wikipedia used to create, edit, and view articles on various topics in collaboration with other users. Number of functionalities entry pages with Markdown-to-HTML conversion, a searchable interface, creation of new entries, editing capabilities, and a random entry generator.

title: Personal Art Gallery
description: An online portfolio showcasing my artwork across various mediums, including pencil sketches, digital illustrations, and acrylic paintings. This gallery offers a clean, user-friendly design, highlighting each piece and my growth as an artist over time.

title: U.S Hospital DRG Data Analytics
description: Data analysis report of hospitals in the United States with trends in average costs of payments and number of discharges per body system impacted. Analysis can be leveraged by patients to determine cheaper hospitals to visit in a certain region of the United States.

title: COVID-19 Worldwide Data Analytics
description: Data analysis report of COVID-19 case data worldwide with trends of cases, deaths, recovered patients, and population in each country.

title: Indian Retail Store Data Analytics
description: Data analysis report of 2022 Amazon sales data from a retail store selling Indian ethnic clothing. Trends of sales per category, average selling price, profits, quantity sold, and popularity of products per country. Analysis can be used to make decisions in inventory and pricing by the retailer.
